s2.name: PHP version
s2.p: If you want to use the default properties file provided with RUBiS, you just have to set your DocumentRoot (in Apache's conf/httpd.conf file) to RUBiS distribution home directory.
If you don't want to modify your DocumentRoot, RUBiS PHP directory must be accessible through a certain path that you'll have to set in the rubis.properties file.

s1.name: Setting Up rubis.properties
s1.p: This files contains information about the http server : name, port, paths for html pages and scripts for each version of RUBiS. The version of RUBiS and the transition table (workload pattern) currently used and are also defined in this file. Various parameters to generate data for the database are provided in this file : number of users, paths to the files with the list of regions and categories, percentage of items with various criteria, maximum number of bids per items, maximum number of comments per user, comments length, etc ...
